intro: Sisyrinchium rahmeri, commonly known as the Arizona bluegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it forms dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Sisyrinchium rahmeri is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems.
